meanings.definition: Put (fear, doubt, or worry) to rest; calm or pacify.
meanings.sent1: She allays my fears by reassuring me everything will be okay.
meanings.sent2: The soothing music allays his anxiety before the big presentation.
meanings.sent3: His gentle smile allays my worries and makes me feel at ease.
meanings.sent4: Like a warm blanket, her words of encouragement allay my doubts.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain tapping on the window allays my fears and helps me sleep peacefully.

meanings.definition: Diminish or put at rest (fear, suspicion, or worry).
meanings.sent1: Taking deep breaths helps to allay my nervousness before the exam.
meanings.sent2: His honesty quickly allays any doubts I may have had about his intentions.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie allays my fears of spiders by distracting me with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her kind gesture allays my suspicions and restores my trust in humanity.
meanings.sent5: The presence of a friend can allay worries and make a difficult situation seem more manageable.

meanings.sent1: Drinking water helps to allay thirst on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: Eating a snack can allay hunger until dinner time.
meanings.sent3: The soothing balm allays the pain of a sunburn.
meanings.sent4: A warm compress can allay the discomfort of a headache.
meanings.sent5: The medicine quickly allays the symptoms of a cold, allowing for a good night's sleep.
